Legal_Issue: Was the applicant denied procedural fairness due to inadequate interpretation during her refugee protection hearing?
Governing_Law: Section 14 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Application_Facts: The interpreter failed to provide precise, continuous, and competent interpretation, resorting to another language (Lingala) and paraphrasing statements. The applicant repeatedly indicated she could not understand the interpreter.
Decision_Outcome: A serious breach of procedural fairness occurred.
Court_Ruling: The application for judicial review was granted, and the matter was referred back for a new hearing.
Grounds_for_Claim: Inadequate interpretation affected the applicant's credibility assessment.
Legal_Standard: Section 14 guarantees the right to an interpreter; translation must be adequate, not perfect.
Assessment_Factor: Quality of interpretation and its impact on fairness
Applicable_Legislation: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Credibility_Assessment: Negatively affected due to inability to understand proceedings
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 14 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Application_Basis: Right to procedural fairness and effective communication in legal proceedings
Governing_Rule: Section 14 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms guarantees the right to an interpreter.
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Interpreter resorted to Lingala and paraphrased instead of providing accurate translation
Outcome: Application for judicial review granted; case remanded for new hearing
Harm_Assessment: Risk of unfair credibility determination due to lack of understanding
Cause_Description: Inadequate interpretation during the refugee hearing affected the applicant's credibility assessment.
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 14 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Evidence_Issues: Miscommunication due to use of incorrect language and paraphrasing
Legal_Provision: Section 14 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Decision_Rationale: Serious breach of procedural fairness due to inadequate interpretation
Evidentiary_Issues: Interpreter lacked competence and used inappropriate language
